document_data.name: Aziza
document_data.mainbody: '''Aziza''' was a seer who lived in [[Huzuz]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}{{cite book/City of Delights/Gem of Zakhara|54}}
document_data.Activities:
Aziza was follower of [[Zann]] and an active member of the [[Readers]]. She ran a small shop called [[Books and Scrolls]] located in the [[Pilgrims' District]].

As a Reader, she collected books merely to have things to read, rarely giving the book's subject matter more than a cursory glance before purchasing the volume. She was an accomplished [[Mystic (Zakhara)|mystic]], charging the handsome sum of 125 [[dinar]]s for a reading. If no vision came to her, she often created a broad telling that was open to the interpretation of the customer.
